title: 108_hr5341
content: The "State High Risk Pool Funding Extension Act of 2004" extends funding for state high risk health insurance pools. The "State High Risk Pool Funding Extension Act of 2004" extends seed funding availability for an additional year and increases funding for state high risk pools in fiscal year 2005. Requirements for qualified high risk pools are also amended, including changes in operational grants and the definition of qualified high risk pools. The "State High Risk Pool Funding Extension Act of 2004" extends funding for state high risk pools in fiscal year 2005 and amends the definition of qualified high risk pools to allow for alternative enrollment mechanisms. The "State High Risk Pool Funding Extension Act of 2004" extends funding for state high risk pools in fiscal year 2005 and amends the definition of qualified high risk pools to allow for alternative enrollment mechanisms. The amendments made by this subsection shall apply to grants for fiscal years beginning with fiscal year 2005, including changes in the allotment formula for operational grants. The "State High Risk Pool Funding Extension Act of 2004" extends funding for state high risk pools in fiscal year 2005 by allocating funds to qualifying States based on the number of uninsured individuals. The "State High Risk Pool Funding Extension Act of 2004" allocates funds to States based on the number of uninsured individuals and the number enrolled in high risk pools. Administrative provisions include eligibility requirements for grants. To be eligible for a grant under this section, a State must submit an application to the Secretary as required. No entitlement to a grant is provided under this section.
